title: Meth Drinker - Self Titled LP and Self Titled EP
description:
Meth Drinker formed in 2009/2010 with Tony, Sam and James keen to start a band playing slow, ugly, straight up sludge music, in the vein of Grief and Noothgrush, as something different from the faster D-beat and thrashcore it's members were playing in other bands. Meth Drinker released a self-titled album in 2011 in a pressing of 100 12Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ and 100 CDs through guitarist Sam's record label Always Never Fun Records but after making little effort to push the release the band went on hiatus as drummer Tony travelled overseas.


During this break Meth Drinker's releases and youtube vids were picked up a number of influential metal blogs and interest in the band began to increase leading to the first pressing of vinyl selling out. In 2012 a spilt 12Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ vinyl album was released with Hamilton's doom-sludge band Open Tomb. In 2013 a second edition of 300 Meth Drinker albums were pressed and in May the band embarked on a 27 show tour of Europe and Ireland with Graves at Sea and Dead Instrument.

Lineup
James Quick: Bass/Vocals
Sam Thurston: Guitars
Tony Pearson: Drums/Vocals

Tracklist
01 deprivation
02 incurable illness
03 ganja mutt
04 combat shock
05 skull smashing concrete
06 the shining (main title)
07 serrated corridor
08 narco sub
09 broken down & used up

That same song ends with a little Casio melody playing within a bit of crackling thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll make you wonder whatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s wrong with your speakers, until you realize the only thing wrong is the awful music youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re listening to.
